docTitle.titlePart:
HORO
Pass ser
JESU CHRISTI Lange
Dagur, Allra Rietttruadra hiarta kyrre gode friä
dagur [...] VALERII| HERBERGERI Predikara
hia Christi Jötu j Frawenstad under polskre
kronu. göda friadags Erfide fordanskad af. Sevaldt Thomessonn Nordh: (1r)

msItem.title: Horoscopia passionis domini Passion-viser Jesu Christi
msItem.author: Valerius Herberger

msItem.rubric:
Lytell formale Til lesarans
Jesu Christi pyningar Historia er sundurdeilld 4
Dagr og Nætur Stunder
msItem.incipit: Elskulegir i Jesu þar er einginn giorningur [er] frasaga
msItem.explicit: hier til viliann og ad fullkomna Amen.

msItem.rubric: Stutt Innehalld allra þeira Dags og nætr Stunnda sam I þessumm Pasiu wyser er ummtalad
msItem.incipit: Skyrdagr kuelld nær kluckann er siö
msItem.explicit:
Þv allra kiæraste HERRA JESU Amen
AMEN
msItem.colophon: þesse Bök var skriffud i Willinngahollte aff Jone presti Ellendssÿne Anno 1651. In Martio. Jon prestur Ellendsson Manni propria

msItem.note: This is an Icelandic translation of Sevaldt Thomesøn's Danish translation of Horoscopia passionis domini Passion-viser Jesu Christi, published in Copenhagen 1637.

msItem.title: Bible commentary
msItem.incipit: Jnnsetningar ordinn So sem þau stannda skrifud af Gudspiallamonunum Math 26. Marc 14. Luc 22.
msItem.note: F. 76r serves as a title page with the text Walerii HERBERGERI written in the centre of the page.

msItem.title: Book of Isaiah
Esajas, spádómsbók
msItem.rubric:
Esaiæ Röt
Utploóckud [Af] þeirre kostulegu og andlegu Esaiæ Jurta bökar
11. Cap. Og nidur sett og saad J Allra frömra truande [...] Utsett fyrst ä Þÿsku Af
Valerio Herbergero. Og nú nÿlega
utlagt j Donsku af Christiano Juno [...]
msItem.note: An Icelandic translation of Danish translation of Valerius Herberger's Jesus Das Edele Hertzblümelein und Krafftröselein aus der Wurtzel Isai.

msItem.title: Commentary on the Book of Isaiah
Geographia historica Orientalis
msItem.author: Hans Hansson Skoning
msItem.rubric: Hans Hanssonar Skonning yfer Geographiam Historiæ Orientalis
msItem.incipit:
Erlegum og Welbyrdigum manne Otte Marsvin Til
Dybeck
msItem.note: An Icelandic translation of the 1641 edition of Geographia historica Orientalis.

supportDesc.support: Paper. Watermarks: Two towers, Arms of Amsterdam, some initials as a countermark.
supportDesc.extent: i + 92 + i. 292 179 . The leaves were trimmed in preparation for binding.

foliation.p: Foliation in pencil in the upper-right corners.

supportDesc.condition: The rubric on f. 77r and the beginning of the rubric on f. 86r have been trimmed and are thus illegible.

layout.p: The text is written in one column with 28-31 written lines per page. F. 76v is blank.

additions.p: On fol. 1r there is a note dated to 1756 and signed Erlendur Jonsson, with a later addition Profastr i Era.
Between fols 1v and 2r there is a blue slip of paper which is now bound together with the manuscript. It preserves the text of Fögru Önnu kvæði which starts with the rubric: Kvædi af fogru önnu.

On f. 75v there is a note: Þesza bók á húsfreýa Maria Gudmundz dóttir á Kollastödum
henni gefin af H. Jónssyni.

physDesc.accMat:
The following items are kept together with the manuscript:
A note written by Finnur Jónsson on the content of the manuscript: Håndskriftet består af 3 dele [...] er mig ellers ukendt
F. J..
A title page of the printed edition of Liber Antibarbarorum from 1520 by Desiderius Erasmus from Rotterdam: ANTIBAR
BARORVM D. ERASMI
ROTERODAMI, LIBER UNUS [...] NIVM ANNO M. D. XX.. Possibly previously glued onto f. 76r.
A lithograph of an angel and a praying woman. Possibly previously glued onto f. 76v
An invoice from Levin & Munksgaard Bookstore, for Islandsk Haandskrift purchased for 65 DKK.
The old binding, fragments of other manuscripts and printed materials.

origin.p: The manuscript is written in Iceland between 1650-1672. It is written by Jón Erlendsson of Villingaholt, so his death in 1672 is a terminus ante quem for this manuscript. On f. 75v, a colophon has the date 1651.

history.acquisition: According to Agnethe Loth (unpublished catalogue of Accessoria collection from 1968), The Arnamagnæan Collection in Copenhagen bought this manuscript on from Munksgaards Antikvariat for 65 DKK.

recordHist.source: Catalogued on 7 January 2019 by Katarzyna Anna Kapitan.

custodialHist.custEvent: Under conservation by Birgitte Dall from to .
